Science of Cambridge MK14 SC/MP 4MHz 256B 8 digit LED Room for more RAM, but no storage £39.95 PCW • Feb 1978 pg. 8, PCW • May 1978 pg. 10 Self assembly kit with hex keypad.
Newbear 77-68 6800 1Mhz 256B Front panel with switches and LEDs Cassette deck ~£50 PCW • Feb 1978 pg. 16, PCW • Jan 1979 pg. 19 A kit of parts.
Lynx Electronics NASCOM I Z80 4MHz 2KB TV Cassette deck £226.90 PCW • Feb 1978 pg. 20, PCW • Feb 1978 pg. 24 Kit computer. Lynx is a subsidiary of North American Semiconductor (US-based).
CASU Limited SUPER C System Z80 4Mhz 32KB VDU terminal 500KB 8" floppy disk £6950 PCW • Feb 1978 pg. 29 VDU (Visual Display Unit) terminal not included in the price.
SWTP 6800 6800 24KB VDU terminal Twin 600KB 8" floppy disks £4900 PCW • May 1978 pg. 36, PCW • May 1978 pg. 42, PCW • Feb 1979 pg. 34 Flex DOS. Price is approximate depending on configuration.
EXTEL Microfile IMP-16 32KB VDU terminal Twin 8" 312KB PerSci floppy disks £6500 PCW • May 1978 pg. 38 Commercial 16KB BASIC.
Commodore PET 2001 6502 1Mhz 4KB Monochrome monitor 40x25 Cassette deck £600 PCW • May 1978 pg. 44 8KB Microsoft BASIC 1.0 in ROM.
Research Machines RML 380Z Z80 4Mhz 32KB TV or VDU One or two cassette decks £1400 PCW • May 1978 pg. 47 8KB BASIC.
Processor Technology Sol Terminal Computer SOL-20 8080A 2Mhz 8KB 64 x 16 Cassette deck PCW • Jul 1978 pg. 38, PCW • Sep 1978 pg. 5 BASIC/5; S100 bus.
MOS Technology Inc. KIM-1 6502 1Mhz 1KB 6 x 7 segment LEDs; also supports VDU output 32 x 16 uppercase Cassette deck PCW • Aug 1978 pg. 24 Tiny BASIC supported with 4KB RAM expansion; 15 minute load time.
Tandy Corporation TRS-80 Model I Z80 1.774Mhz 4KB-48KB 64 x 16 monochrome Cassette deck; 5¼" floppy disk drives 85KB (later 180KB) $599 4KB; $899 16KB; $2385 16KB + disk drive + Level 2 BASIC; $3874 32KB + 2 disk drives + line printer PCW • Aug 1978 pg. 44, PCW • Sep 1978 pg. 7, PCW • Sep 1978 pg. 26, PCW • Oct 1978 pg. 24, PCW • Jan 1979 pg. 33, PCW • Feb 1979 pg. 44 4KB ROM Level I BASIC (based on Tiny BASIC); from mid-1978, 12KB ROM Level II BASIC (Microsoft)—this needed disk drive and expansion bus.
Apple Apple II 6502 1Mhz 16KB TV or VDU 40 x 24; 280 x 192 x 6 colors; 40 x 48 x 16 colors Cassette deck; 5¼" floppy disk drives 113KB (later 140KB) £1250 (£1520 including TV and cassette deck) PCW • Aug 1978 pg. 50, PCW • Sep 1978 pg. 9, PCW • Jan 1979 pg. 67 ROM Integer BASIC; Applesoft Extended BASIC (Microsoft)
North Star Computers Horizon Z80A 4Mhz 16KB VDU 80 x 24 5¼" floppy disk drives 90KB 1 disk drive (Horizon I) £1275; 2 disk drives (Horizon II) £1550 PCW • Sep 1978 pg. 6 S100 bus; North Star DOS with Extended BASIC; Optional CP/M which includes CBASIC, Microsoft Extended BASIC, MAC macro assember, Microsoft COBOL-80 and Fortran-80.
Exidy Sorcerer Z80 2Mhz 32KB TV or VDU 64 x 30; 512 x 240 Cassette deck and cartridge slots £950 PCW • Nov 1978 pg. 71 12KB ROM BASIC; S100 expansion unit; ROM cartridges for “Standard” (Altair) 8KB BASIC, Assember/editor, other languages, DOS, applications.
Comememco Z-2D Z80 4Mhz 32KB 2 x 5¼" 90KB disk drives £2,450 PCW • Dec 1978 pg. 40 Cromemco 16KB Extended BASIC; Cromemco FORTRAN IV; Cromemco Z80 macro assembler; S100 bus.
Pertec Attache 8080A 2Mhz 16KB 64 x 16 2 x 8" floppy disks of 310KB £4,728 excl. monitor PCW • Feb 1979 pg. 29 S100 bus; BASIC (8KB RAM); Extended BASIC (16KB RAM); MITS300-5A (Microsoft MBASIC) BASIC (24KB RAM)
